LEI ALOHA
By Harry Owens and Chick Daniels
Leialoha a blue lagoon is calling
Healoha the tropic moon is beaming
And the moonlight the starlight
Proclaim a night for dreaming
And dreams come true for I love you
Leialoha.
Leialoha, I love you, I adore you
Leialoha there was no one before you
And hereafter no laughter will fill the
night with
music
Unless your heart belongs to me
Leialoha.
Leialoha our song of love is ending
But,
darling, the dream is just beginning
There'll be sorrow tomorrow until
my
way is
wending
Back here to heaven in your arms
Leialoha.
TO YOU, SWEETHEART, ALOHA
By Harry Owens
To you, sweetheart, Aloha,
Aloha from the bottom of my heart;
Keep the smile on your lips,
Brush the tear from your eye,
One more Aloha, then it's time for
goodbye;
To you, sweetheart, Aloha,
dreams I'll be with you, dear, tonight;
And I'll pray for that day when we two
will meet again,
Until then sweetheart, Aloha.
ONLY JET
POWER SERVICE in Hawaii
Sing these Aloha Airs as you fly between Islands with Aloha Airlines
BLUE LEI
You were wearing a blue lei
The day that I first met you;
As we wandered on the sand
By the blue, blue sea
With not a cloud in the sky to distress us
Not a care have you or I to suppress us.
I shall always remember
The moment when I kissed you,
For the smile upon your lips
Was heavenly sweet,.
When your blue eyes looked into mine
It was then the sun began to shine,
That day in May
You wore a blue, blue lei.
LOVELY HULA HANDS
Lovely hula hands graceful as the birds
in motion,
Gliding
like the gulls over the ocean
Lovely hula hands-Kou lima nani e.
Lovely
hula
hands telling of the rains
in the valley
Of the swirling winds over the pali
Lovely hula hands-Kou lima
nani e.
I can feel the soft caresses of your
hula hands
Your lovely hula hands
Every little move expresses so I understand
All the tender meanings,
Of your hula hands-fingertips that
say aloha
Say to me again I love you
Lovely hula hands-Kou lima nani e.
Special Half-Fare Family
Plan Flights Daily
LITTLE BROWN GAL
It's not the islands fair that are calling to me
Its not the balmy air nor the tropical sea,
It's just a little brown gal in a little grass
skirt in a little grass shack in Hawaii.
It isn't Waikiki nor Kamehameha's Pali-
Not the beach boys free with their
hoomalimali
It's just a little brown gal in a little grass
skirt, in a little grass shack in Hawaii.
Through that island wonderland, she's
broken all the kane's hearts-
It's not hard to understand for that
wahine is a gal of parts-
I'll be leaving soon for the thrill I enjoy-
It's not the island moon nor the fish and
the poi-
It's just a little brown gal in a little grass
skirt, in a little grass shack in Hawaii.
SWEET LEILANI
Sweet Leilani, heavenly flower
Nature fashioned roses kissed with dew
And then she placed them in a bower
It was the start of you;
Sweet Leilani, heavenly flower
Tropic skies are jealous as they shine-
I think they're jealous of your blue eyes
Jealous because you're mine.
Sweet Leilani,
heavenly flower
I dreamed of Paradise for two
You are my paradise completed
You are my dreams come true.
ALOHA is the Island way

MODERN JETPROP FLIGHTS.
Aloha Airlines F-27s bring all the
islands within minutes of Honolulu and Waikiki on the Island
Only Aloha Airlines offers jet powered flights between
the Islands. You fly in pressurized comfort aboard aircraft that
are air-conditioned on the ground as well
as in flight.
You relax in
vibration-free
ease to the hushed sound of fast depend-
able Rolls-Royce engines.
FLIGHTSEE EN ROUTE.
The scenic wonders
of Hawaii are spread out below you when
you flightsee by Aloha Airlines. Your JET-
PROP F-27 featuring exclusive high-wing
design and large oval windows is designed
to give you complete visibility from every
seat.
FULL COLOR MAP.
The cartographic map
inside pictures the major islands of Hawaii
-it's your souvenir of Aloha's F-27 jet power routes between
Islands.
TOUR ARRANGEMENTS.
See your travel agent for all
tour ar-
rangements.
Let him plan your all-Islands vacation via Aloha
Airlines-the only jet powered service between Islands.
ALOHA AIRLINES
CASTA
HONOLULU INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, HONOLULU, HAWAII, U.S.A.
OFFICES ON ALL ISLANDS

Beach scene on the Garden Island of Kavai.
KAUAI is be Garden Island
Area: 555 square miles.
27,922.
Population:
Principal
town:
Lihue.
Dis-
tance from Honolulu: 90 miles.
Kauai is the oldest of all the inhabited Islands of Hawaii.
It is also the first on which Europeans are definitely known
to have set foot: in 1778, when Capt. James Cook sailed
into the Pacific to discover the Islands.
Kauai is a treasure island of scenic spectaclesâ€”the Spout-
ing Horn, Kalalau Lookout above the Valley of the Lost
Tribe, awe-inspiring Waimea Canyon, Hanalei Valley-
Birthplace of Rainbows, the Sleeping Giant, the wet and
dry caves of Haena. Deep ravines, many of them populated
by wild game and native birds, cut the island in many places.
The coast is lined by some of the most magnificent sand
beaches in the world.
These in turn are enclosed by sweep-
ing coral reefs. Between the mountains and the coast there
are belts of fertile plains with farming and grazing lands.
Kauai boasts the only navigable rivers in Hawaii. Its swift-
rushing mountain streams are stocked with trout.
Sleeping Giant, one of many scenic wonders on Kauai.
to see Hawai
you MUST SEE
ALL THE ISLANDS
There's something to see,
something to do on all the
islands of Hawaii, all year round.
All the islands are dif-
ferent
each is only a few scenic minutes from your
Waikiki vacation hotel via your Rolls-Royce powered Jet-
prop F-27.
Here, on these islands so near Waikiki, is the Hawaii
you came to see-
-the highest mountains in the Pacific
Ocean,
beaches of jet-black
sand,
primitive settlements
hidden in rainbow-colored valleys.
You who are camera enthusiasts
have a special thrill ahead when
you fly in your high wing Jetprop
F-27 over the scenic grandeur of
the Islands. The exclusive high-
wing
design
of
your
Jetprops
allows you to take excellent pic
tures
of Hawaii's
incomparable
scenery from any seat in the air-
craft.
There is no low wing to
obstruct your view.
And your jet powered F-27 flies
specially
at the
smooth
lower
King Kamehameha Statue
altitudes so you can see more of the scenery you came
so far to enjoy.
ALOHA AIRLINES FARES are low, with the Aloha Air-
lines Half-Fare Family Plan helping
you to
economize
even more on your tours.
The popular Half-Fare Family
Plan is available during specified
hours during every day
in the week. Ask your travel agent about it or inquire at
your nearest Aloha Airlines office.

For Your SAFETY...
Just in Case
(Please Read)
SAFETY REGULATIONS REQUIRE
THAT INSTRUCTIONS EXPLAINING
PROPER DITCHING PROCEDURE
BE ISSUED FOR THE INFORMATION
OF ALL OVER-WATER
AIR PASSENGERS

find inserted in the vest at chest height, and turn the
mouthpiece to the left (counter-clockwise). Press
the mouthpiece against your teeth, push down, and
blow. When the vest is fully inflated, screw the
mouthpiece to right.
AT SEA - IN STYLE
By now you've been directed to your raft and have
stepped aboard. There are sufficient life rafts on all
Alohaliners to accommodate everybody, and you'll
find them surprisingly well-equipped and comfort-
able. They carry rations, first aid kits, fishing equip-
ment and every aid to insure prompt rescue, including
dye-markers for rescue planes to spot.
Since a spe-
cially trained member of the crew will be in charge
of your life raft, all you have to do is keep cool and
calm. He has complete authority and is responsible
for your safety. Naturally, you give him your full
cooperation.
CRUISING COMFORTABLY
â€¢ â€¢ â€¢
Now you're cruising comfortably, but it won't be
for long. Even before your plane started to come
down, your Jetprop's radios told all air search and
rescue bases in the Hawaiian Islands of your exact
position.
So you'll see radar-equipped planes and
rescue ships arriving on the scene very soon.
And now you know about Ditching Procedure. So
relax and enjoy your flight, for in the extremely
unlikely event that you ever should have to use
your knowledge, you'll know exactly what to do.
2007. 007.044 e
AWARD
MERIT
1960
ALOHA AIRLINES, INC.
ALOHA AIRLINES, one of the scheduled airlines in the United States,
has been
operating with a perfect safety
record since it started
operations in 1946-a
record as of December
31,
1961 of more
than three hundred and sixty nine million accident-free passenger
miles.

"DITCHING"
â€¢ . . WHAT'S THAT?
Pilots in World War II affectionately nicknamed the
English Channel the "Ditch," and sometimes had to
make forced landings in it. That's why an emergency
landing anywhere at sea in a land aircraft is known as
"Ditching:"
Interesting isn't it?
NO WET FEET FOR YOU!
Relaxed in your comfortable
seat, you can be secure in the
knowledge that your Rolls-Royce
powered Jetprop has every
scientific safeguard that could
possibly be needed for any emer-
gency. And you should be well
aware that Aloha Airlines' splen-
did record and carefully trained flight crews all add
up to assurance that you'll land where your ticket
says you will landâ€”without getting your feet wet!
THERE'S A PROPER PROCEDURE
But just as International Maritime Regulations re-
quire passengers on the high seas to be instructed in
life-boat procedure, so you, too, should know about
your Jetprop's emergency equipment in the very
unlikely event that you take part in a Ditching.
To make an unexpected sea landing safely and com-
fortably there are a few simple things you must know
how to do, and when to do them. Let's proceed, then,
to some pointers on Ditching Procedure ... so you
can take to the water as serenely as a sea gull.
FIRST THINGS . â€¢ â€¢ FIRST
Each member of your Alohaliner
crew has been carefully trained
in emergency procedure.
The
crew members will assist you,
but you'll help, of courseâ€”by
keeping calm and following their
instructions.
Life vests are fashionable in
emergency landings.
Yours is quite handsomely tailored.
You'll find one
in the zipper pocket on the back of each seat (pas-
sengers in the front row of seats will find theirs in
a rack under the seat).
"PREPARE FOR DITCHING"
Imagine that your Captain has
decided to prepare for a Ditch-
ing. He'll give the order "Pre-
pare for Ditching." When you
receive the order, remove any
sharp objects such as pencils
from your coat, take off your
glasses, loosen your collar, re-
move your tie, and if you're wearing high-heeled
shoes, take them off. Don't take off any other clothes.
(You'll want to look your best when you land
and you'll be warmer in the life raft, too.)
Now take your life vest out and slip it over your
head with the narrow straps at the back. Attach the
metal ring on the left narrow strap to the snap in
front, and the ring on the right strap to the other
snap.
The vest is very simple to inflate, but don't inflate it
until
you are outside the ditched airplane.
READY? . . . GET SET!
Next, adjust your seat as far for-
ward as it will go (in an upright
position) and fasten your seat
belt snugly around you. Just be-
fore landing, lean forward as far
as possible and rest your arms on
your knees.
KEEP SEATED ... AND CALM
You'll next hear the order,
"Stand by for Ditching,"
You're in your seat, of course, and when the plane
makes contact with the water you'll feel two bumps
-the first slight, the second stronger. Until the plane
has completely stopped moving, stay in your seat.
Then unfasten your seat belt. You'll be told when
it's time to leave the plane and step into your life raft.
THAT FASHIONABLE VEST
When you're out of the airplane
you can blow up your life vest.
It's very easy. Just pull the two
cords at the bottom with a sharp
jerk downward,
first one
and
then the other. If the vest does
not inflate immediately, take the
end of the rubber tube you'll
